sentences.english: Iron sharpeneth iron, so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
sentences.chinese: 朋友互相砥礪，有如以鐵銼鐵。

definition: scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
see a worthy, think to imitate (idiom, from Analects); emulate the virtuous/Follow the example of a virtuous and wise teacher.
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
a heavy load and a long road/fig. to bear heavy responsibilities through a long struggle (cf Confucian Analects, 8.7)
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
